values:
Libra--- Today is a great day to let your artistic nature shine through, dear Libra. Your sense of color and patterns are right on target and your words are more poetic than usual. Create a time and space for your creative inner nature to manifest on the physical plane. Let your fantasy world spill out on to a piece of paper for others to see. You have tremendous gifts, so feel free to share them with the world.

Personal Horoscope by Birthday--- You might be feeling a bit stressed out, drkseraph, though not terribly so. Your mind probably won't be on household chores; your thoughts are likely to drift toward intellectual, philosophical, and spiritual concepts that have been on your mind for the past few days. This is a good day to indulge yourself by spending it resting, relaxing, and reading, allowing your thoughts to drift where they may. Enjoy!

You have cat eyes. If you're irritated about
something, people would automatically know,
whether looking in your eyes or analyzing your
body language. You may have other subtle ways
of letting people know how you feel. You hate
to be bothered, and prefer not to deal with so
many people. That's what makes you a bit of a
solitude person. You can have fun when you want
though. That's what makes you interesting.

What Animal Eyes Do You Have?

Okay, I have started a new community dedicated to writers of fan fiction inspired by the works of Laurell K. Hamilton. The community <lj user="dark_seductions"> is new and it's an open community for the writers of Anita Blake or Meredith Gentry fan fiction.

It's new, so I haven't done much with it, but I would like to try to get the community up and running.

OCTOBER:
Loves to chat. Loves those who loves them. Loves to takes things at the center. Inner and physical beauty. <s>Lies but doesn't pretend.</s> <s>Gets angry often. </s> Treats friends importantly. Always making friends. Easily hurt <s>but recovers easily.</s> Daydreamer. Opinionated. <s>Does not care of what others think.</s> Emotional. Decisive. Strong clairvoyance. Loves to travel, the arts and literature. <s>Touchy and easily jealous.</s> Concerned. Loves outdoors. Just and fair. Spendthrift. <s>Easily influenced.</s>Easily loses confidence. Loves children.

What do you guys think?

I'm going to Alchemy tonight to see Voltaire and Cruxshadows.

I am dressing as a goth Cleopatra. :)  Black velvet dress instead of white.  Even have a beaded head dress.

*bounce bunce*

I woke up in a pretty good mood to begin with. Was happy with new schedule at work and excited about tonight.

Then, all at once, that changed.

That's when I found out that people that I care about dislike/hate/resent my child and her presence.

I'm not sure how I'm supposed to feel.

Nothing like starting your day in a fit of tears and killing your entire mood.

This is going to be a post of many things that I have wanted to say for a little while, but have never had a chance to do for whatever reason. So now that I am having a slight lull in calls at work while our main frame gets rebooted, I have a chance to at least start writing what has been going on in my mind. Work: I work for a company that runs a medical database that the military. I do NOT answer to the military. I do NOT work for the military. I do NOT get paid by the military. I am a Civilian. I do not have to take shit from any military people that call here. They need my help, not the other way around. They will be polite or else there will be ramifications.So the comment about target on my butt was out of line. No, my supervisor is not male. She is a female. We are told to be honest with the people that call here. The person in question that had me in tears wasn't military, either. He was one of our guys, being a prick. He has since been disciplined. Just because you put up with shit like that and don't handle it the same way, doesn't mean that I will. I am sorry that you had such negative experiences, but don't proceed to try to make me feel worse about myself and guilty of your treatment by others when I am ranting in here. Many of us have done tech support. many of us have gotten asshole callers. I know several people who are reading this have either been a) reduced to tears by a caller or b) been so pissed off they wanted to break something. Traffic: I hate traffic! 2 hours in traffic both ways. I hate it. There are too many stupid drivers on the road and I think I should be allotted the money for the research and development of a Romulan Disruptor. You know, that cool weapon that they fire and whatever it hits just dissipates? I want one. I want one mounted to my little car. I want one to fire at the trucks and the stupid SUV drivers that decide that they want to run over my car just because they want exactly where I am at the particular time. Lexus, Mercedes and BMW drivers are the worst of the worst. Parenthood: I have a child that I love and adore. There are things that I don't want her exposed to. It is not anyone else's responsibility to take care of her. It is mine. This rant was encouraged by this: Why is it that as soon as a couple have a child, they suddenly claim that you can't fully experience life until you are a parent, or womanhood until you are a mother? Since when did parenthood turn into such a cult? Part of response to my beloved was as follows: "Exactly! You know how much I love Chey, but there are things in this world that she isn't ready for, no matter how much she thinks she is. However, it is my responsibility and right to decide what she can and can't see or do. It pisses me off that there are so many parents who want everyone else to take care of their children for them. Fuck that. You know what kind of things I'm into, but Cheyenne never gets to see that because I don't allow her to. I don't show her things that I think she isn't ready for. It's my responsibility to watch out for her and no one else and as a parent, it offends me the way some parents act. Grrr. "You've taken all of the fun out of being a kid and you've turned your children into little cult objects. Fuck You!"---George Carlin I don't want to take up room in your LJ so I will write my own rant in my own LJ. Love you." George Carlin has a rant about all of the "Think Of The Children" and "What About The Children" bullshit that goes around. You can find that on his CD and DVD "You Are All Diseased" Too many people have taken the fun out of being a child and if I ever, EVER get that way with Cheyenne, please for the love of Ma`at, somebody fucking shoot me, okay? Too many people have started treating children like a fetish or a cult object. It is NOT the government or the media's job to take care of your children. It's yours! I have dear, sweet friends who want to have children but seem to be unable to and it hurts to see their anguish. Yet morons with no common sense of decency are having children right and left---and they expect everyone else to be responsible for taking care of their children. Fuck them to death. Leave my media, my internet, my movies, my books and any other thing the fuck alone. I don't want nimrods with no brains to decide what it is all right for me to watch because of *their* inability to keep an eye on their children. Oh, and just because you have a child, that doesn't make you better than everybody else, either. Some of my best friends, and Cheyenne's favorite people, don't have kids. They make wonderful people to have around. Parenthood isn't a cult. You don't exclude people because they don't have a child. You're not more knowing about what it is to be a human or a woman just because you have a child. Wake the fuck up. My boyfriend has more parenting skills than most parents I know, and he has no kids. Back the fuck off and have a visit with reality. Religion: I had a long rant about this next thing: Give Me A Fucking Break However, I will say this: Can't you wait a little bit before you try force-feeding religion to kids? It just doesn't seem fair to do this...and yes, I checked out the site quite thoroughly. I'm sure there are other things that I wanted to talk about but have forgotten. I'll either add them here later, or make a completely new post.
Sum up your opinion or impression of me in one word, leave it as a comment in this posting, and then post this sentence in your own journal.

YOU ARE FIRE!

Your inner element is one of great passion and
intensity. You are a dramatic person who loves
attention and knows how to get it. You tend to
have many friends and admirers around you wherever you go.
You have a strong intellect, tend to have
strong opinions on issues close to your heart
and don't know the meaning of tact. You are
generally an active person who loves sports and
all things competitive... and you like to win!
Any career that will bring you the attention
you crave and uses your talents of persuasion
is ideal for you. Love tends to elude you
frequently - you can more easily find passion
or good friendship than true love. When you do
finally fall in love... you fall with all your
heart. However, when it comes to the passion
end of things, you are second to none.
Your greatest strengths are your courage to express
yourself no matter what and your incredible
charisma. You weaknesses are a tendency to
narcissism and the possibility of alienating
others with your forwardness. Balancing your
strengths and weaknesses is crucial for you to
achieve balance in your life.
Astrologically, Fire is associated with the signs
of Aries, Leo and Sagittarius. You are most
compatible for either love or friendship with
another Fire Elemental or with an Air. You are
least compatible with a Water Elemental.

Now that you have an idea of your strengths and
weaknesses, why don't you put them to the test?
If you follow my lead I can take you to a game
world where you can explore different sides of
yourself and taste real power....
...and all
the world can be yours.

You are Form 0, Phoenix: The Eternal. "And The Phoenix's cycle had reached
zenith, so he consumed himself in fire. He
emerged from his own ashes, to be forever
immortal." Some examples of the Phoenix Form are Quetzalcoatl
(Aztec), Shiva (Indian), and Ra-Atum (Egyptian).
The Phoenix is associated with the concept of life,
the number 0, and the element of fire. His sign is the eclipsed sun. As a member of Form 0, you are a determined
individual. You tend to keep your sense of
optimism, even through tough times and have a
positive outlook on most situations. You have
a way of looking at going through life as a
journey that you can constantly learn from.
Phoenixes are the best friends to have because
they cheer people up easily.

I just got off the phone with Ponce De Leon

Sweetest thing ever said to me: "To my sweetie on her birthday...you make girls ten years younger than you wish they could look as good as you do." Ace certainly knows the right things to say, sometimes.

My birthday weekend started out like hell.  


<lj-cut text="Friday---Novacaine, Bats, and Chocolate">

Around 1 p.m. on Friday, I bit into my favorite type of sandwich---chicken salad on a croissant. I bit down, crown popped off, tooth broke.  Fuck, that hurt like hell. I started calling dentists and there was one that said they could see me at...2:30 p.m. That meant I had to leave work earlier than I had planned to.  However, when trying to find this dentist, I got lost. Grrr. I went home to try to find a dentist in the phone book somewhere. Luckily for me, two dear friends were waiting at my house because they were going to be watching the munchkin that afternoon after school. My friend Marmel got me into her dentist office and they gave me good care...but told me I would need to get a root canal and they would have to start it immediately.

Fuck and double fuck.

The dentist took real good care of me and made sure he shot me full of plenty of numbing stuff. You would think that with all of the shit and pain I've been through and still go through, that would be nothing.  You would be wrong.  *nods* I am a wimp when it comes to pain in my face or mouth.

He finished the first part, gave me scripts for penicillin and Tylenol 3 with Codeine (which does jack for me) and sent me home.  I go back on the 24th to get the rest of the work done on that part of my mouth.

Marmel took me home and then people started arriving---well we went to drop off my prescriptions first, and she bought me a big stuffed bat.

We ended up not having any kind of group ritual, which was cool by me.  It was much fun with a few of my female friends just hanging out with me and talking about whatever popped into our minds to discuss. It was great fun and we must do more of this.

<lj user="Deoridhe"> and <lj user="animeg"> were very much goddesses. They brought us chocolate and fruit. They rule.

The group of us stayed up much late and had a good time.  Of course, I stayed up much later than Ace wanted me to (he was worried) but it was well worth it.

</lj-cut>



<lj-cut text="Saturday---The Phoenix, Lion King, Chai and Naughty Thoughts">

Saturday morning, Ace showed up as I was waking up.  That made me smile very much. He snuggled up in bed with me and we just snuggled and stuff for a little bit.  Then I got dressed and we went out for lunch. We went to Grand Panda Buffet and met Marmel and Ed.  We had much Sushi and other Chinese type food. We went from there to Loew's so I could make a key for Marmel since she had decided (much to my gratitude) that she was going to take the munchkin overnight. I did not end up making Marmel a key. I ended up making Ace and I new keys.  I found a key covered in flames (Ace) and one covered in leopard spots (me). We gave Marmel AJ's old key. We then parted company.  Ace and I went somewhere (having trouble remembering the first place we went) and Marmel, Ed and munchkin went their own way. Ace and I just...wandered.  We went to a few stores, went and got some Chai...went to see some friends...and just were together. We had no plans, no time constraints, we were just together and hanging out.  Something that we haven't been able to do for a long damn time.

I bought the new Lion King DVD, as well and Ace and I wandered and shared thoughts of non-PG-Rated things.

We stopped by his house where he gave me yet another gift: the model of the Jaguar XKR from James Bond's "Live and Let Die" and he gave me a sweet, sentimental card to go along with it.

Then we went back to my place to watch movies and stuff.  I believe we might have fallen asleep at seven a.m. Sunday morning.


</lj-cut>



<lj-cut text="Sunday---Mooses, Porn, Chai and Other Things">

<lj user="Shorty36"> came up on Sunday and we went wandering. We hit Best Buy and looked for a couple of things.  I found a new Darian Caine movie that I purchased with a Best Buy gift card from my sweetie. I found a few other things that I wanted as well, but refrained. (Buffy Seasons 3 and 4 on DVD.  Gah) We then went to my favorite steak house for dinner: Bugaboo Creek Steak House. I love that place and the food is to die for. We had very much good food, and much to Ace's dismay I would not kiss the Moose.  Nope.  I've seen where that thing has been, and he looks like one of my exes.

From there we went to Target to pick up a few things, then to Borders where I bought much Chai and a new Misty Mundae DVD.  Then we went to Wal-Mart for batteries and a stop watch. After that, Shorty took us back to my place, but he left soon afterwards because he was in much pain.  :( 

Ace and I then entertained ourselves for a bit. *grin*

BTW, To Be Continued on DVDs really fucking sucks!  I must now find a DVD called "The Phoenix Part 2".  Gah!

</lj-cut>


I had a wonderful weekend with my sweetie, and it was a perfect birthday, at least to me.


I will probably write more as I remember more.

How many people have a crush on you?

So, Saturday was my birthday.

I feel so old sometimes and Saturday reminded me just how old I really am.

I know some people have expressed concern that no one has seen anything posted from me or e-mailed or anything and I apologize.  I have been really stressed with work and trying to fight off some kind of deep chest cold.

The good thing is that I wasn't alone Saturday.  Ace showed up at my place around eleven in the morning and he left about half an hour to forty-five minutes ago. We had time to ourselves with no time constraints and no need to be anywhere with anyone for the first time in months.

I'll write more later...I need to get some sleep.

If you call the helpdesk and the girl that answers the phone starts out by telling you that she's knew and trying to learn the mainframe and asks you a lot of questions, telling you that she's trying to make sure she gets the information you're providing straight, please don't yell at her or treat her like she's stupid. Please don't talk down to her, demean her or call her an idiot. That person you're talking to might be me. Going to go for a walk because I'm trying not to cry.

Now, I would first like to make this disclaimer: I believe in Freedom of Religion. I do not have problems with most religions. Most of the people I have met from different religions have intelligent, insightful things to say. That said... Is there something about me that says "Please, Jehovah's Witnesses, preach to me and tell me how wrong my religious choices are!"? *sighs* Three times in three days I have had people pretty much do just that. The third set just left my home. The first time was at work on Thursday, the second time was at Starbucks on Friday, and then now. All three times I told the people that while I appreciate their dedication in what their doing, I am not a JW and never will be. "What religion are you?" "I'm Pagan." The first person I said that to responded with: "What's that mean?" The second person I said that to responded with what felt like fifteen minutes on how being a Pagan was causing me to lose touch with God while I was waiting for my White Chocolate Mocha. The third person I said that to responded with: "Oh. How unfortunate for you." The third set also proceeded to try and talk me into letting them come into my home once a week for a Bible study, even though I had just told them I wasn't interested. "But if you will read the Bible..." "I do." *Stumble, look aghast.* "Then how can you believe the way you do? You may get instant happiness from your Goddess, but in the long run, she will fail you. Only the one God can save you." I am still trying to be nice. I am still trying to be pleasant. I really want to go lay down and try to kill this headache. Then, one asks me what is wrong with my eye. I explain that I have a massive migraine and really can't talk to them right now. "God can help you with that." That's it. Tolerance gone. "Lady, God didn't see fit to help me when I needed brain surgery. I doubt that he cares that I have a migraine." I then shut the door in their face. Now, I don't feel like the Goddess abandoned me when I found out that I was having to have my head cut open. Honestly, I thought about it as I have every other physical ailment that I've been diagnosed with in the last few years. Why not me? If it wasn't me going through this, someone else would be forced to. It's the whole balance thing. I'm going through all of these things because the Goddess feels that I am strong enough to survive these ailments where someone else may not be able to. Ace helped me figure that out three years ago when I was diagnosed with the back condition and had gotten really depressed about it. I've been told that I shouldn't be able to get around as well as I do, but I do. Maybe I was too short with the ladies who came to my door doing their work, but I had tried to get them to leave nicely. When I have a migraine I have high tolerance for very few people. I have high tolerance for family, but not for strangers. Cheyenne is now glaring at me and reminding her that I promised her I would lay down until the headache went away.

Isabel vs. Honor - When Hurricane Isabel was bearing down on Washington, D.C. yesterday, (Thursday, September 18) Washington did what it often does - panic! The federal government was closed yesterday as were the area's schools - even though up until 7:00 PM last night the day was only rainy with brief gusts of wind. But while everyone else was running for cover, there was a different character on display at Arlington National Cemetery, just a few miles from my office. The cemetery is "home" to 260,000 veterans. It is also the site of the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier, which was built in 1921 to honor those who died for our country, but whose remains have never been identified. The Tomb is watched 24-hours-a-day by the 3rd U.S. Infantry Regiment, known as "The Old Guard." Cemetery officials were in a dilemma. The Old Guard has never abandoned its post guarding the Tomb. But as Isabel slammed into the area last night winds hit 75 miles an hour and the rain was torrential. The cemetery officials, no doubt thinking of possible lawsuits, gave the Old Guard permission to leave their posts for safety sake. You guessed it, my friends - the soldiers refused to leave! Staff Sergeant Alfred Lanier said the Tomb was something "we cherish." Sgt. Christopher Holmes said leaving the Tomb is "never an option for us" and added he was prepared to die while guarding it. As Eisenhower asked when he surveyed the bravery on the beaches of Normandy, "Where do we get such men?"

Who can guess where this quote came from and by who? and are not allowed to guess. That wouldn't be fair. =) "I never sweat it about a Romulan dude "He's just a limp-wristed Vulcan with a bad attitude."
I must find more Tiger Bars!!!! Dark chocolate with Espresso beans... it helps me get through the day here!!!

Voltaire - The Vampire Club Oh, the moon was full and the color of blood The night the pirates came to the Vampire Club. Their leader was tall and snide and slim. He looked like a gay Captain Morgan, Well, he recognized a vampire from his school, And he did something that was most uncool. He said, "Hey everybody, see that fool in the cape? His name's Bernie Weinstein, And he's in the 8th grade!" Fangs were flying, capes were torn. Hell hath no fury like a Vampire scorned. The number one rule in this game: Never call one by his real name. Wigs were pulled, top hats were crushed By pointy boots in a rush. And Boris at the bar orders a Bud and says, "It's just another night at the Vampire Club." Missi lost a fang in the ladies room, And we all laughed and called her 'Snaggletooth!" And Dee was mad cause he broke his cane, And he flushed his contacts down the drain. There was so much angst after the fight, Vlad and Akasha broke up that night. While some rivet-heads danced in a puddle of goo That used to be "Father" you-know-who! Fangs were flying, capes were torn. Hell hath no fury like a Vampire scorned. The number one rule in this game: Never call one by his real name. Wigs were pulled, top hats were crushed By pointy boots in a rush. And Boris at the bar orders a Bud and says, "It's just another night at the Vampire Club." Well, its hard to believe but we're still around, And when we hang out it's upside down. Dressed in black from toe to head singing, "Bela Lugosi's still undead!" A gaggle of goths is a peaceful site. We'd do anything to avoid a fight. But if you really want to see some gore and blood, Wait 'til the ravers come to the Vampire Club. Fangs were flying, capes were torn. Hell hath no fury like a Vampire scorned. The number one rule in this game: Never call one by his real name. Wigs were pulled, top hats were crushed By pointy boots in a rush. And Boris at the bar orders a Bud and says, "It's just another night at the Vampire Club."

Just a little something I wrote for an RPG that I'm in. Lemme know what you think and if you would like for me to continue the story or not. Dani read and re-read the note from Scott Summers as she sat at her desk. "Dani, In light of recent events, I think that it would be best for you to use your contacts to try to shed some light on the Brotherhood. I'm sure you'd be much more familiar with areas that would be valuable learning resources, so I'll leave it to you to decide at your discretion. I'm sure you'll turn up some invaluable information. Be careful, though. We can't really afford to lose you. Scott Summers." "...Be careful, though. We can't really afford to lose you..." Dani smiled faintly at that last statement. She'd swear that Scott knew of her misgivings about returning to Xavier's. She placed the note in a drawer of her desk. Between S.H.I.E.L.D. and the MLF, she knew better than to be caught with anything that could be used against her. She packed a few things into her saddle bags and then wrote two quick notes--one for Pietro, and one for Scott. She wasn't sure how she would be greeted at either of the two places she was headed to. However, she was taking no chances. Both places were known for making people disappear without a trace and she had no intention of becoming one of those statistics. S.H.I.E.L.D. had trained her to always let two operatives know where she was going--in case one turned out to be dirty. She trusted Scott implicitily, but for her own reasons, she wanted Pietro to know exactly where she was headed as well. She slipped the notres under the appropriate doors and headed out. She had sat on the cliff's edge for about a half an hour when she heard the sounds of people approaching. Taking a deep breath, she notched one of her special arrows into her bow and turned to face her old teammates. There were three of them, and none of the three looked particularly pleased to see her. The one that she had really hoped to see was the one who wasn't there. "Moonstar." "Wildside," she nodded in return, still on guard. She was already calculating battle strategies in her head. "You have some nerve coming back here after what you did." She tilted her head. "And what exactly did I do?" she asked. "You abandoned us," Wildside spat. "Turned yur back on us and left after Reignfire..." "I saved your ass more than once," she cut him off, not wanting to think about what happened with Reignfire and after. "I could take your head," the one holding the sharp scythe threatened menacingly. "You could try, Reaper." Dani laughed as she powered up the arrow. This was pretty much how she had expected things to go, so she wasn't surprised that she was about to get into a nasty fight with three members of the Mutant Liberation Front. "You can't take all three of us, Moonstar," the third one finally spoke up. "Perhaps not, Heather, but I'm willing to bet that my odds are better than yours are." Reaper shook his head. "Same mouthy bitch as always, Moonstar." "Unlike you, I stick to what I know." As the three spread out in an attempt to surround her, Dani let an arrow fly. Heather went down with a scream---a scream which turned into several shrill cries and a babbling that no one could really make out. As Wildside rushed her with a howl, Dani flipped over him. She fired a second arrow as one of his claws sliced into her cheek. He went down and she turned to face Reaper. He swung his scythe at her and dani jumped back, but not fast enough. The tip of his weapon caught her deep in the shoulder, and the pain caused her to stumble. She landed on her back as he yanked his blade out of her shoulder. "I told you I'd take your head, Moonstar," Reaper grinned as he swung his scythe. His weapon connected with metal and it was jerked out of his hands. He started to draw another weapon---then saw who stood between him and his prey. "Damn it, Forearm," he complained. "I was only having some fun." "Not with her," the big man growled. "Never with her." "Awww..." Dani mocked as she got to her feet. "No head for you." Reaper glared at her. "One of these days, Mind-Witch, it's gonna come down to you and me---and the big guy won't be around to save you." "Go," Forearm ordered. "And take Wildside and Tempo with you." The two of them stood in silence as they watched the others walk away. "Danielle." "Michael." "You took a big risk coming here, Dani. You should have just sent for me. I would have met you anywhere." Dani sighed. "No point in hiding, Mike. We both know..." Mike nodded. "...that one of these days one of us will kill you. Sometimes, I hate that other power of yours, Danielle." "Sometimes, so do I." Mike hugged her. "I've missed you my friend." Dani smiled. "I've missed you, too, Mike." "But you're not here just for a friendly visit. Nor did you come to test your skills against the team. Ask, and if I can, it's yours." "I need information, Mike. The Brotherhood." "Damn it, Dani! Are those assholes after you?" Dani bit the inside of her cheek to keep from laughing out loud at the irony of one terrorist organization calling another "assholes". She swallowed. "I have nothing concrete, yet, Mike. However, if it is them, I'd like to have as much ammunition as possible." "Makes sense. I'll tell you what I know...on one condition." She raised an eyebrow. "Which is?" "You ever end up going against them, you call on me for back up---I don't care which damn team you're fighting on." Dani stared at him for a moment. People often assumed that Forearm was a big, dumb tank. She knew better. He rarely missed a thing. Finally, she nodded. "Agreed." Mike nodded and he sat down on one of the large rocks. "The Brotherhood is a group of mutant terrorists. They're worse than the MLF. I know it's hard to believe, but it's true. We attack humans that are known to attack mutants or that are involved in projects that are dangerous to mutant-kind. The Brotherhood doesn't make any discriminations on that. They hate all humans." "Do you know how many of them there are or who leads them?" "I believe the last report we received had there being about thirty or thirty-five in that group. I don't know the name of the leader, but I have heard that he's a pretty powerful fellow. He's rumored to have a way with metals and stuff." Dani took a deep breath. There was only one man that she knew of that fit that description. Magneto. Mike continued. "They take great delight in causing all kinds of problems for humans...and any mutants who don't think the same way they do. Dani...be careful. These guys play rough and I don't want you ending up dead. You're the one person I've called friend in a long damn time and I don't want to end up standing over your grave." Cross-posted at
